title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4900.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4900.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

The following terms shall have the following meanings: (a) Authority shall mean the

Rochester-Genesee Regional Transportation Authority, a public benefit
corporation created pursuant to title 11-B[14] of the Public Authorities Law of
the State of New York. (b) Subsidiaries shall mean all of the public benefit subsidiary corporations of
the authority. (c) Freedom of

Information Law shall mean chapter 578 of the Laws of 1974, as amended by
chapter 933 of the Laws of 1977, constituting article 6 of the Public Officers

Law. (d) Rules shall mean the
regulations set forth in this Part. (e) Records shall mean any information kept, held, filed, produced or reproduced by the authority and its subsidiaries, in
any physical form whatsoever, including but not limited to reports, statements, examinations, memoranda, opinions, folders, files, books, manuals, pamphlets, forms, papers, designs, drawings, maps, photos, letters, microfilms, computer
tapes or discs, rules, regulations or codes, if any. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
4900.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
